Posts.Content: Aug 14, 2008 05:43PM g94u67 wrote: Hi Genia, Well I KNOW exactly how you feel about the exasperating waiting game. I was DX on 7/2. My OB referred to a surgeon first (a good one) who recommended chemo 1st then surgery because I too have it in my lymph gland.  Well I was lucky to get to see the oncol. on 7/15. Then by the time I had my 3 scans (they all came out clean Amen) I finally will begin chemo tomorrow.  8/15! But DON'T stress too much.  I thought for sure the cancer had spread all over.  It hasn't. The good thing is you now have a Dr. who is on top of it and is working for you. Some Dr's are good, some aren't.  It stinks because we trust them. I didn't have the needle lymph node biopsy. I'm kind of glad because I don't want to know.  I just want to kill the cancer. I'll keep you in prayer. Jeannine

Posts.Title: Repeat Brain MRI on Thursday DianaT VickiG

Posts.Content: Aug 12, 2008 02:43AM g94u67 wrote: Hi Genia, This is by far one of the biggest, traumatic, most emotional, events in your life! It's okay to be down, and as I've learned (I've only been DX myself since 7/2) you have your good days and bad ones.  I haven't started TX yet.  I will begin on Friday. It gets easier to digest day after day but BC will remain in your mind. Talk to your Dr's. I've seen 4.  I didn't want to waste any more time w/a 2nd opinion. I have IDC grade 3 tumor that's advanced to my lymph glands so they're recommend chemo first before surgery. This method seems to work well in aggressive tumors so ask your Dr. It may be the route for you. You are so right. This web site has been so therapeutic.The women here are so supportive and KNOW exactly how we feel.  Also:  Keep on praying and give all that worry to the Lord. It's helped me. God Bless, Jeannine
Posts.Title: I just wanted to say thank you!!! Genia mussylou

Posts.Content: Oct 28, 2009 02:30PM g94u67 wrote: Hello  Well I have a little different take on the gene analysis testing.  Please get it done as soon as she can. My daughter is 20 and I'm glad she did. (Tested negative) Your daughter is young but why go through so many years of wondering and worrying when you can know as soon as both of you are able to? Prevention is the key! I think knowing and preparing is good. If she's + it's not a matter of "If" it's "When". Yes it's a blow to find out but it can be a lifesaving fact. Had I known my gene results (BRACA1+) 5 days prior to my lumpectomy last year, I would have totally changed my decision. I was set to have my prophylactic DBL MSX this June when unfortunately I was hit w/recurrence and IBC. Sorry I disagree with Ivorymom. 6 months ago I may have agreed, but then again I thought I was in the clear and had more time. Good luck to you and think hard. Discuss with her when the time is right. Jeannine

Posts.Title: More Tips (and a Shopping List) for Getting Through Chemo rock MinusTwo

Posts.Content: Apr 13, 2009 04:17PM g94u67 wrote: Hi Alison, I have a similar story like Sharebear and am a TN girl. I was 41 at DX. I chose lumpectomy after 8rounds of AC/T last year. HOWEVER, I am BRC1 positive too (got results AFTER surgery)and now I am opting for a DMX and oopherectomy as prevention.  So getting the gene tests results is very important in making your surgery decision!  (Just to put you a little at ease, it is pretty rare to test positive for the mutation.) The good news for you is they caught it early. Bad news maybe chemo. Have you seen a 2nd opinion?  I thought I needed to start TX ASAP but you do have time to research and decide.  Like everyone has said, you will get your life back and be stronger. Good luck to you. Jeannine
